intro: Palmeria fengeriana, commonly known as the Fenger's palmeria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, coastal areas and thrives in well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
